info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 11:25PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado... Colorado River near CO-UT State Line affecting Mesa and Grand Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near CO-UT State Line. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Considerable agricultural flooding is likely between the Redlands and Fruita. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM MDT Sunday, May 28 the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 12.0 feet this week. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, and please heed all trail and roadway closures. Water levels along the Colorado will continue to run high with fast flows and flooding in some areas. Please use caution if recreating on or camping near the river. High water often occurs at night and river conditions may change rapidly.
